Job Title:       Sr. Windows SRE Administrator

Department:  EIS \u2013 Traditional Services \u2013 Windows Group

Location:        Nomura NYC ( currently remote )

Start:              As soon as possible.

Overview:

Nomura Windows group is a global team responsible for the maintenance and support of the Windows infrastructure systems used within the bank. The team plays a critical role and works closely with global counterparts in maintaining the production infrastructure and provide Windows related services to our clients.

 

This is an exciting role and the successful candidate\u2019s primary responsibility will be to provide support for the firm\u2019s Windows infrastructure. The team operates in a follow the sun support model.

 

The candidate must be a good team player, highly articulate, and be able to work well in a high pressure and technically challenging environment. The candidate should be passionate about supporting Windows based servers in highly virtualized environment. Good technical, communication and interpersonal skills are particularly important.

 

Windows requirements:

 

  • As a Windows SRE administrator, the candidate will expected to build software that will increase the efficiency of daily support. This will also include updating runbooks and support procedures.
  • Knowledge of and Support of Operating System versions 2008, 2012 and 2019.
  • Knowledge of Active Directoy administration and the ability to modify GPOs
  • Candidate should be able to deploy and support MS Windows clusters.
  • The ability to create active directory administration script, and Windows OS support scripts, via scripting languages (PowerShell is highly preferable, while ability in Python, VBScript, Jscript/JavaScript to achieve the scripting objective here is also a big plus )
  • General support and administration of Anti-Virus such as Trend Micro and Windows Defender.

 

Role / Principal Accountabilities

\u00b7       Support and Manage Microsoft Windows based systems.

\u00b7       Responsible for looking at ways to improve and automate SRE items which include availability, latency, performance, efiiciency, and capacity planning

\u00b7       Troubleshooting support and system performance issues.

\u00b7       Handling of trouble tickets, user requests, proactive maintenance.

\u00b7       Support weekend BCP / DR tests.

\u00b7       Assisting application teams in post-configuration of new servers deployed.

\u00b7       Candidate should have a good understanding of ITIL and Change management policies.

\u00b7       Cordination with Infrastructure teams and Business IT managers to deliver projects on schedule.

\u00b7       Implement engineered solutions to improve efficiency and stability of the infrastructure.

\u00b7       Provide documentation for 1st line Operations team and maintain run books.

\u00b7       Weekend oncall production support on a rotation basis.

Skills & Experience Required:

  • Familiarity with Site Reliability Engineering components
  • Deep understanding of Windows OS, Cloud and associated tools.
  • Deep understanding of active directory, and how enterprise class identity and access management (IAM) is extended from on-premises environment to public cloud.
  • Cloud tools such as  Ansible, Kubernetes, and Docker are a plus.
  • Familiarity with Cyberark and Windows time services is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of Virtual (VMware) and physical networking configuration.
  • Strong ability to troubleshoot issues and provide resolution.
  • Ability and desire to learn and work independently as well as in a team
  • Project management and organizational skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are a must.
  • Analytical and disciplined approach to problem solving.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationship with in the infrastructure teams.
  • Previous experience with supporting a banking infrastructure is preferred.

 

 

Additional qualifications:

 

\u00b7       Hardware support for HP DL380 and Cisco B200

\u00b7       TCP/IP, Networks and Firewalls.

\u00b7       Client/Server systems

\u00b7       Familiarity with Enterprise Monitoring systems is desirable

\u00b7       Good understanding of Information Security policies.
